snippet: Low supplies in Western Europe have caused tension to the east during an especially frigid winter.
abstract: Dwindling supply of natural gas in Europe has led to officials in Russia and Ukraine blaming each other for the shortfalls, accusing each other of drawing heavily and inappropriately on the shared pipeline system that transports fuel to Western Europe; though the shortage is reminiscent of past disruptions in Europe's fuel supply, usually caused by rancor between Ukraine and Russia, gas consumption is up across the region due to severe cold weather, leading to dwindling supplies.
lead_paragraph: Low supplies in Western Europe have caused tension to the east during an especially frigid winter.

headline.seo: Tempers Rise Over Gas Supply to West From Russia
headline.main: As Europe Shivers, Russia and Ukraine Point Fingers Over Natural Gas Supply to the West
headline.print_headline: As Europe Shivers, Russia and Ukraine Point Fingers Over Natural Gas Supply to the West
